course_description: Virtually every aspect of business is instrumented for data collection & data is increasingly analyzed systematically to improve business decision-making and offer competitive advantage.This class will study the fundamental principles and techniques of data mining. We will improve our ability to approach problems "data-analytically", we will examine real-world examples that place data mining in context, and we will apply data-mining techniques while working hands-on with a data mining software.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the One-Year or Two-Year MBA program.
sections: Class Nbr: 4752, Section #: 3201, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: B. Schmidt, Status: Open
